result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth R Brown

records.addlTxt:
Hearing on December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:32 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Kenneth R Brown in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Kenneth R Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Wolff provides an update; he is trying to work with his client to resolve the matters but is asking that either this case and/or 21CM915 be set for jury trial and all other matters tag along with for status.  State will take no position with respect to which case proceeds to trial.  Based on the charges the Court will have 21CF915 set for trial and all other matters will tag along with for status.  Atty. Wolff believes that case will take about 1 day for the trial.  State agrees.  Court will schedule 21CF915 for trial and all other matters will tag along with for status.
Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:20 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Kenneth R Brown in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Kenneth R Brown.  Atty. Wolff provides an update, he is requesting the matters be set for plea and sentencing in about 45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:44 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Kenneth R Brown in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Reider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a Second Amended Criminal Complaint has been filed and reviews it on the record.  Atty. Wolff acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters initial not guilty plea.  Atty. Wolff advises he now has a global offer, but needs a little more time to review discovery on the most recent case.  Atty. Wolff requests a status date in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Court also advises that the defendant needs to report to the Business Center after court today to address his payment plan for his court appointed attorney.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 02:07 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Kenneth R Brown in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wolff notes he was appointed by the Court and is not sure if his appointment was extended on all of the defendant's matters.  Court will extend Atty. Wolff's appointment on behalf of the defendant in all of his cases.  Atty. Wolff provides an update, he is requesting another further proceedings date to allow time for him to obtain a global offer.  Atty. Wolff also notes the State may be dismissing the old OWI charges associated with this case based on the new OWI filing.  Atty. Nickolie confirms she just filed a Petition to Dismiss Counts 2 & 3 in this matter only and presents statements.  Atty. Wolff has on objection to the State's Petition.  Court inquires if the State could just file an amended complaint just listing the charge that will remain.  Atty. Nickolie will file an amended complaint.  Atty. Wolff requests a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth R Brown

Prior: 1834 Cardinal Dr., Waukesha, WI 53186 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth R Brown
Current: 1834 Cardinal Dr., Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 06-07-2022)
Prior: 2706 Albany Ct, Waukesha, WI 53188

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle during the pendency of the case.

01:18 PM Defendant Kenneth R Brown in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Attorney appears as friend of the court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Attorney Wolff states he is court appointed.  The Court utilizes the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel out of 21CM216.  The Court swears in the Defendant.  The Court questions the Defendant as to his financial situation since July 16, 2021.  The Court extends the appointment of Attorney Wolff.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
